file_content.text: You were pivotal to the Thuls gaining prominence over House Organa. The Moff tells me to congratulate you.
Moff Sarek speaks highly of your service with the Thuls.
Enslave the rebel and take him to Thul palace. Moff Sarek will contact you with further instructions.
A good day to you.
Greetings, my lord.
Welcome, sir.
I bring the good wishes of Moff Sarek, the officer entrusted with annexing this planet.
He wished to speak with all of you when you arrived.
He has been anticipating your arrival.
It is fitting that we speak.
Of course.
I am at his service.
Of course.
Either I'm moving up in the world, or there are people he wants dead.
He has?
Knowing the Moff, sir, I would guess more than a few.
What's this about?
I would not presume to answer that. The Moff can explain to you himself.
Tell him I'll find him when I get a moment.
I'll see him later.
I'm afraid he wishes to speak to you right now.
Good day. I was hoping to meet one of you. It is truly a windfall for the Empire to see all of you in one place.
Good day, my lord. It will well serve the aims of the Empire to have so accomplished a Sith on this planet.
Good day, sir. Your services to the Empire are well known... to those with the proper clearance.
Good day. You have served us before, have you not? A valuable hire.
I expect you care little for the niceties of politics here, so I will be brief.
The Empire intends to use Alderaan's succession struggle to bring it into the fold, and I'm offering you the opportunity to play a pivotal role.
Alderaan would make a fine jewel in the Empire's crown.
I would be honored to help.
Is this a job interview, then?
Opportunity, huh?
Oh, you have the job if you're willing. We would not be speaking otherwise.
Succession struggle?
I'll need details before I put my neck on the line.
What role is that?
The heir to Alderaan's throne was recently assassinated... right after withdrawing from the protection of the Republic.
The planet's in civil war and, for the first time in thousands of years, without the armies of the Republic to bring order.
A divided world will fall quickly.
The time is right.
Yes. We must make our move now, while the throne stands empty. We have an alliance with one of the noble houses, House Thul.
That's a long time. Has the Republic really given them up?
They will not welcome us.
The Republic has its proxies here, as we have ours. We have allied ourselves with House Thul.
So what?
House Thul is our proxy on Alderaan.
The house was exiled sixty years ago after a failed bid for power and came to us instead. Unfortunately, they have proven too weak to do what's needed.
Do they need the fear of the Emperor put into them?
You want me to change that?
Yes.
You got someone they're not killing for you?
You need me to change that?
Yes. But Thul must also learn what it means to be an arm of the Empire.
Perhaps we should trust their methods.
This is their planet.
If Alderaan is to be part of the Empire, they must learn what that means.
I still haven't heard a job.
Jorad, one of the Thul lords, insists on following Alderaan's rules of "civilized warfare." I want you to show him warfare is far from civil.
Several of Thul's vassal houses have rebelled since Thul's connection to us became public. This cannot be allowed.
Take a slave collar from my man here and drag one of these rebels to our weak-willed Lord Thul. Kill the rest and leave them where they fall.
These Alderaan lordlings will beg to serve the Empire.
They will cower before us.
They will learn that the best way to survive is to submit.
That will send a message.
Right. Kill the rebels.
These "lords" of Alderaan must lose their foolish pride. Those who will not bow... must break.
